channel.title: [First website] HeavenX website
channel.description:
So recently i've started a bit with HTML/ CSS. I don't really want to keep things private, because web developing is a great thing, and everyone should learn.
This one is from scratch.
Great nav bar [img]http://i.gyazo.com/39da678fcbbb122cd17acd64403b3f2a.png[/img] [img]http://i.gyazo.com/7b22926a89d8871eef245f54a4c130f8.png[/img]
Nice news boxes [img]http://i.gyazo.com/82cca6d0625ffef52a28a5a7b9e1c915.png[/img]
Epic footer [img]http://i.gyazo.com/3ca81272a2acf4925c763b145eed0fdf.png[/img]
HeavenX: [url=http://shaloxiswebdevs.comule.com/themes/heavenxwebsite.zip]Download[/url]
[url=http://shaloxiswebdevs.comule.com/]More themes by me[/url]

item.title: [First website] HeavenX website
item.dc:creator: @Flame3 John
item.description:
@Flame3 wrote:

I think you’re confusing simple and basic. A website should be using the most up to date code and not be complex to who is using it, but should still embody the extent of the abilities of a website developer.

Read full topic

item.title: [First website] HeavenX website
item.dc:creator: @Coldmedicine Coldmedicine
item.description:
@Coldmedicine wrote:

I think a website should feel basic.

That’s what makes a website a website.

It’s just my opinion.

John, could you add me on skype?
Waddafoock

Read full topic

item.description:

[quote=“Coldmedicine, post:3, topic:546056”]Could you please tell me what could be improved?
Because i literally didnt know anything else[/quote]
I don’t know any web design/development, John went ahead and took care of that for you. I was speaking more about the design/look and feel of it though, it just doesn’t feel very interactive if you get what I mean. I wish I could explain it better, it just feels basic and static.

Read full topic

item.title: [First website] HeavenX website
item.dc:creator: @Flame3 John
item.description:
@Flame3 wrote:

Good work for your first website. Remember, you’re always going to have room for improvement, and the majority of these listed below are mistakes almost everyone makes their first time. I took a look at the code and have a few criticisms:

Before anything, you need to have a DOCTYPE declaration in every HTML document. In HTML5, the declaration is

Aside from what I said above, you also no longer need to include type=“text/css” in HTML5.

You misspelled body in your tag.

Refrain from using the tag in your website. Support for it has dropped since HTML5’s release, and you should center elements by using either text-align: center; or margin: 0 auto; in your styling.

Rather than using the long URL provided when you copied the image location for your image in the news post, save your images in a folder labelled img, images, etc. and reference those instead.

If you’re going to use a style more than once, use a class rather than an ID.

Instead of

, HTML5 allows the use of .

You have a second (correctly spelled ), tag inside of your parent tag. An HTML document only uses one.

A general tip for the future, keep readability in the back of your mind when making your websites. Neatly tabbed and written code is much easier to work with.

Read full topic
